Muhurat trading guide: Timings, history, and what to expect on Diwali 2024Muhurat trading is a unique session conducted by Indian stock exchanges on Diwali, rooted in the belief that this 'auspicious hour' is a time to attract prosperity.

Waaree Energies share price falls 3% after bumper debut. Here's whyWaaree Energies listing: Shares of Waaree Energies opened at Rs 2,550, at a premium of 69.66% over its issue price of Rs 1,503 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

IndiGo share price tumbles over 10% after Q2 results. Buy, hold or sell? IndiGo share price: The shares crashed as much as 13% on Monday, reaching a low of Rs 3,778.50. At 10:54 am, shares of the company were trading 7.66% lower to Rs 4,030.35.

Reliance share price showing 50% fall on trading apps today. Here's whyRIL share price: Reliance shares opened at Rs 1,338, which appeared to be 49.61% lower than Friday's closing price of Rs 2,655.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Twist in JioHotstar drama, Dubai siblings claim they bought domain from developerThe JioHotstar.com controversy has taken a new turn as the Delhi developer, who bought the domain much to the annoyance of Reliance Industries, seems to have sold it to two Dubai-based children -- Jainam and Jivika.
ITR filing deadline for corporate taxpayers extended till November 15ITR filing deadline: The extension applies to taxpayers covered under sub-Section (1) of Section 139 of the Income-tax Act, 1961.

ED raids in Mumbai, Haryana against pharma company in Rs 220-crore fraud caseDuring the search operations in Mumbai and Haryana's Yamunanagar, movable assets including bank funds, Demat accounts valued at Rs 14.53 crore were seized or frozen.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak amid ongoing FII exodus, dull Q2 earnings At the closing bell, the Sensex was down 662.87 points at 79,402.29, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 189.55 points lower at 24,209.85.

Waaree Energies IPO: Will it double your investment? Here's what experts sayWaaree Energies IPO attracted significant interest from investors and was subscribed 79.44 times by the end of the bidding process on October 23, 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Over 150 injured, 8 critical, in fireworks accident at Kerala temple festivalThe injured were shifted to several hospitals in Kasaragod, Kannur, and Mangaluru, where they are receiving treatment.

Baba Siddique's son, Salman Khan get threat call, ransom demandedZeeshan Siddique and Salman Khan received the threat calls on the evening of October 25. The police have registered a case based on a complaint by Zeeshan Siddique's office.

Fake cops, warrants, Rs 10 lakh surety: India Today busts digital arrest racketIndia Today's special investigation team conducted a sting operation to uncover a racket of digital arrest scammers.  The fraudsters came in touch with our reporter, claiming that a parcel in his name was found with 400 grams of drugs.

No quid pro quo at work here: Jeff Bezos on Washington Post's Kamala Harris snubJeff Bezos said the Washington Post's decision to stop endorsing US presidential candidates was a move to shore up credibility and asserted that political endorsements 'create a perception of bias'.

Can saffron priced at Rs 3 lakh per kg solve all your skincare problems?Saffron can work wonders for your skin, but it's also one of the world's most expensive spices. When it comes to skincare, are you in the mood to splurge or save?

Washington Post loses 2 lakh subscribers amid Harris endorsement row: ReportAmazon founder Jeff Bezos, who also owns The Washington Post, defended the newspaper's decision not to endorse a candidate for the November 5 US presidential election as "right" and "principled".

India Today at President Biden's Diwali partyThe Diwali event on Monday night was attended by more than 600 eminent Indian-Americans, including Congressman Shri Thanedar, US Surgeon General Vice Admiral Vivek H Murthy and Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund.

1 dies, 15 fall sick after eating momos from same vendor in HyderabadThe Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has initiated an investigation into the vendor's operations. Food safety officials, in collaboration with police, located the stall and discovered it was operating without a valid licence.

Kunal Kamra accepts Ola CEO's offer to work, but with 4 conditionsKunal Kamra and Ola's Bhavish Aggarwal earlier had a heated conversation on X when the former pointed out the piling up of Ola Electric scooters outside what appeared to be an Ola store.

Elevating Your Career with IIM Kozhikode's Advanced Operations Analytics and Supply Chain Management ProgrammeElevate your career with IIM Kozhikode's comprehensive programme, designed to equip professionals with the latest tools and strategies in operations management and data analytics. Gain hands-on experience through live sessions, capstone projects, and industry-relevant assignments, while accessing the prestigious IIMK Executive Alumni network.

Mother of child spiritual speaker names Bishnoi gang in case against YouTubersThe complaint was filed by the mother of the 10-year-old spiritual speaker against the YouTubers, who uploaded videos which were "maliciously designed" to mock and defame his religious beliefs.

UN body for Palestine banned from operating in Israel despite West's concernsThe lawmakers who drafted the law cited what they described as the involvement of some United Nations workers in the October 7 attack on Israel, and staffers having membership in Hamas and other armed groups.

From ancient India to British rule: The 2000-year journey of the Indian mapFrom the expansive Mauryan Empire, which laid the brass tacks for a unified India, to the culturally rich Gupta Empire, maps reveal a vibrant history. The Indian maps from the time of the Mughal and British empires further illustrate the complexities of territorial evolution in the latter period.

Rodri becomes first Manchester City player to win Ballon d'OrSpain's Rodri became the first Manchester City footballer to win the Ballon d'Or on Monday, October 28. In a glitzy ceremony in Paris, Rodri beat the Real Madrid duo of Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham to clinch his maiden award. The Premier League and Euro 2024 champion became the first midfielder since Luka Modric to win the Ballon d'Or title.

The official Friends Instagram page encouraged fans to remember his legacy through the Matthew Perry Foundation.

On the brink, Canada food bank to turn away international studentsA Canadian food bank is turning away from first year international students, who come to it in high numbers amid high food prices and rising unemployment. The Greater Vancouver Food Bank has been slammed for its move to deny free food to new international students.

BJP's Shaina NC joins Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena after party fields her as candidateShaina NC was keen to contest from Worli in Mumbai, but the seat was ultimately given to Shiv Sena's Rajya Sabha MP and former Congress leader Milind Deora.

Big B recalls Ratan Tata borrowing money from him for a phone callAmitabh Bachchan shared a heartfelt memory of Ratan Tata borrowing money for a phone call, highlighting the industrialist's humility. The episode will air on Kaun Banega Crorepati 16, featuring Farah Khan and Boman Irani as guests.

Cricket at 2028 Olympics likely to be moved out of Los AngelesCricket competitions for the 2028 Los Angeles Olympic Games may be held on the US East Coast to reach the massive Indian audience and capitalize on the sport's growing popularity in the United States, says host committee chair Casey Wasserman.

IND vs NZ: Injured Kane Williamson to also miss third Test in MumbaiStar New Zealand batter Kane Williamson is set to miss the third Test against India as well as he continues to recover from groin injury.

'Dil-Luminati' mess at Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium cleaned up The Sports Authority of India (SAI) announced that the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium has been cleaned and is ready for its next event on October 31, just hours after the stadium was left in disarray following a two-day concert by singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh.

Pickleball's rise hits India in with first world-ranking tournament Pickleball's popularity soared globally, captivating fans and players alike, including former tennis stars. With India embracing the sport, recent tournaments showcased its rapid growth and accessibility, proving that age is no barrier to enjoying this engaging game.

Ramandeep looks to make a mark with India: My role model is Andre RussellKolkata Knight Riders' Ramandeep Singh is ready to shine for India in the tour of South Africa. Ramandeep, who sees Andre Russell as his role model said that he wanted to prove himself at the international level by taking whatever chances he gets.

Will beat Australia in Australia: Rizwan drops tall claimNewly appointed Pakistan captain Mohammad Rizwan has backed Pakistan cricket team to win the white-ball series in Australia. Rizwan, who was announced as the captain on October 28 will be put to Test Down Under in November.

The curious case of Prithvi Shaw: From being next Tendulkar to going out of favourOnce hailed as the next Sachin Tendulkar, the enigma called Prithvi Shaw is now out of favour even with his state team. What went wrong with this prodigious talent?

Whoever raises voice will get sidelined: Basit Ali on Gary Kirsten's resignationBasit Ali reacted on Gary Kirsten's resignation from his post as the Pakistan team's head coach in white ball cricket. He pointed out that PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi is a powerful man and whosoever will raise their voice will get sidelined.

Erik ten Hag quits as Manchester United manager after West Ham defeatErik ten Hag has left his role as Manchester United manager after the side's unfortunate defeat to West Ham in the Premier League, which has left them only 3 spots away from relegation. United confirmed in their statement that assistant manager, Rudd van Nistelrooy will take over the role.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
